title: Foods High in Water
author: WebMD Editorial Contributor
medically_reviewed_by: Kathleen M. Zelman, RD, LD, MPH

content: Your body needs water to function. Because you constantly lose water through breathing, perspiration, urine, and bowel movements, you have to replenish your body's water supply regularly.

Research originally recommended that you drink 8 ounces of water eight times a day. However, newer guidelines suggest that you drink water when you’re thirsty — unless you require extra water due to your activity level, where you live, whether you are pregnant or breastfeeding, and your health. If you let thirst be your guide, you will likely meet your body's hydration needs.

According to the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine, adequately hydrated women consume an average of 2.7 L (about 92 ounces) of water each day, while men consume about 3.7 L (125 ounces) daily. These amounts cover fluids from water, other beverages, and food.

sections.heading: Why You Need Water
content: Water is essential to your survival. In your body, water works by:
bullets: Moistening your eyes, nose, and mouth tissues
Bringing nutrients and oxygen to your cells
Dissolving minerals and other nutrients for your body to use.

content_blocks.text: Water is essential to your survival. In your body, water works by:
associated_bullets: Moistening your eyes, nose, and mouth tissues
Bringing nutrients and oxygen to your cells
Dissolving minerals and other nutrients for your body to use.

content: If you lose more water than you take in, you can easily become dehydrated . Common causes of dehydration include vomiting, diarrhea, fever, infections, and not drinking enough water in hot climates or when exercising. The symptoms of dehydration in adults are:
The symptoms of dehydration in babies or young children, include:
If left untreated, dehydration can lead to serious problems, such as:
Heat Injury (heat cramps, heat exhaustion, or life threatening heatstroke)
bullets: No urine in their diaper for three hours
Sunken soft spot of the top of their head
Low blood volume shock (a life-threatening amount of oxygen in your body)

sections.heading: Foods With Water
content: Although 80% of your daily water intake usually comes from beverages, the other 20% usually comes from foods.
Here are 10 foods high in water:
bullets: Cucumber Because it is 95% water, one serving of cucumber has only 8 calories. Cucumber is also a good source of fiber , vitamin K , and vitamin A .
Tomatoes Tomatoes are a rich source of water as one cup of sliced raw tomato contains 170.14 g of water.

Watercress The high amount of water in watercress is surely one of the reasons this vegetable topped the list of "powerhouse fruits and vegetables" compiled by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Apples Per a 100-gram serving, apples have 85.56 g of water, making them a perfect snack for staying hydrated.
Celery Celery is a healthy vegetable that is made mostly of water. A single cup of it contains 115 g of water.
Lettuce Water makes up over 95% of raw lettuce . In addition to helping you stay hydrated, lettuce helps with bone strength, vision, and sleep.

Watermelon This juicy fruit gets its name from containing 92% of water serving as a great snack for staying hydrated. Watermelon is also power packed with beneficial nutrients and is a great source of antioxidants .
Peaches Although the fiber content in peaches makes them a filling food, they are made up of 88% water.
Broth Broth is a soup base often made by simmering bones in water with seasonings. You can add vegetables to broth to make it extra hydrating.
Zucchini One cup of zucchini contains 95% water and contains 1 g of fiber that keeps you feeling full.

meta_description: Water is one of the basic elements of life and is essential to your survival. Learn which 10 foods to eat to get more water.
